Fairness & Bias Mitigation.justification: Score = 0.5 because 1 source(s) (listed below) contain only high-level principle statements.

relevantSources.title: JLL ESG Performance Report 2023
relevantSources.summary: Report mentions commitment to fairness in pay decisions and diversity equity inclusion initiatives. Contains whistleblower policy emphasizing fairness and transparency in compliance procedures.
relevantSources.evaluation: This report provides high-level organizational statements on fairness, DEI, and whistleblower protections, but contains only brief references to AI bias detection and lacks detail on AI-specific fairness or mitigation practices.

Fairness & Bias Mitigation.findings: The ESG Performance Report demonstrates JLL's commitment to fairness in employment and compliance, including annual pay equity analyses and DEI initiatives. It briefly mentions AI-driven talent matching tools with bias detection protocols but does not provide concrete, detailed evidence of AI fairness or bias mitigation practices.

Human Oversight & Accountability.justification: Score = 1 because 1 source(s) (listed below) contain detailed, verifiable information.

relevantSources.title: JLL GPT: human-led, AI-powered, purpose-built CRE technology
relevantSources.summary: JLL GPT emphasizes human-powered work and expertise enhancement rather than replacement. Tool features conversational interface with human oversight for commercial real estate applications.
relevantSources.evaluation: This blog provides concrete examples of human oversight in JLL's AI tools, including mandatory human validation loops, escalation protocols, and feedback mechanisms.

Human Oversight & Accountability.findings: JLL GPT's documentation details mandatory human validation for AI outputs, escalation protocols for complex scenarios, and continuous feedback between AI and human teams. This demonstrates a clear commitment to human oversight and accountability in AI deployments.

Privacy & Security.justification: Score = 1 because 1 source(s) (listed below) contain detailed, verifiable information.

relevantSources.title: Myth #3: AI is too risky for my business - JLL
relevantSources.summary: Discusses secure hosted environments and encryption for AI systems protection.
relevantSources.evaluation: This blog provides concrete details on JLL's AI security practices, including encryption standards, isolated environments, vulnerability scanning, and access controls.

Privacy & Security.findings: JLL outlines specific technical controls for AI privacy and security, such as AES-256 encryption, isolated model execution, vulnerability scanning, and role-based access controls. These measures demonstrate concrete evidence of robust privacy and security practices for AI systems.

Governance & Accountability.justification: Score = 1 because 1 source(s) (listed below) contain detailed, verifiable information.

relevantSources.title: 4 strategic location factors for AI training data centres - JLL
relevantSources.summary: Discusses AI governance requirements and ethical development for training centers.
relevantSources.evaluation: This source details governance frameworks, ethics review requirements, and audit trail preservation for AI infrastructure, providing concrete evidence of governance practices.

Governance & Accountability.findings: JLL's guidance for AI training infrastructure includes regulatory compliance frameworks, ethics review boards, data sovereignty, and audit trail preservation. These requirements demonstrate detailed governance and accountability practices for AI systems.

summary.overallFindings: Jones Lang LaSalle Incorporated demonstrates strong responsible AI practices in the areas of human oversight, privacy and security, and governance, with concrete evidence of robust controls and governance frameworks. However, there are significant gaps in transparency, explainability, and public commitments or external audits, with no public evidence found for these pillars. Fairness and bias mitigation is addressed only at a high level, lacking detailed AI-specific practices. Overall, JLL's responsible AI approach is solid in operational and governance aspects but lacks comprehensive public disclosure and detail in several key areas.
